value: Jup, you can ski in Morocco.

is a ski resort in the
.  It is one of the few places in
where skiing is possible, and it also boasts the highest ski lift in Africa (reaching 10,825 feet).
Morocco’s best ski resort and Africa’s highest at 10,734 feet. Drive towards the town of

in the Ourika Valley, the last exit before Setti Fatma at the foot of the mountain will take you to Oukaimeden. The road is covered and in good condition. To get you to the top you have your choice of chair lift, T-bar or donkey. The best skiing in the Atlas Mountains is found in January to February.
In January and February it's actually possible to get the distinct accomplishment of having skied in Africa under your belt. 45 kilometres south of
, high in the Atlas mountains, lies the "ski resort"

, sitting at 2,600m. The resorts single chairlift (or the optional donkey) takes you up to 3,258m – at the peak of Jebel Attar. One you're up there, there are five runs to take you down again, the longest of which is some 3 kilometres, alternatively take some of the less imposing drag lifts at the bottom of the slope. A one day ski pass should set you back some 90 Dirhams. There are four hotels to choose from if you want to sleep over.

value: content=it is a nice new chalet in a spectacular landscape near mount Toubkal (4176m), the highest peak in North Africa. 3 rooms, American kitchen, chimney , it is a suitable place to go skiing in Africa, and also for trekking.

Chez Juju, tajines, french saussage cassoulet, mixed grill, salad with goat cheese. Sunny terrace : + 212 524 319 005.

value: content=On the right past the army camp just before the lifts. Decent sized rooms but dirty with broken tiles and loose power sockets. The hotel is in desperate need of a refurbishment but with 101 rooms it is quite likely to have a vacant room. Although open in summer, it's near abandoned and empty.
, new rooms chalet style with bathrooms. 00 212 524 31 90 05
